intro: Garnotia villosa, commonly known as the hairy garnet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and unique foliage structure.
